soot.jimple.infoflow.aliasing

Interface IAliasingStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAliasStrategy, AbstractBulkAliasStrategy, AbstractInteractiveAliasStrategy, FlowSensitiveAliasStrategy, ImplicitFlowAliasStrategy, PtsBasedAliasStrategy

    public interface IAliasingStrategy
    Generic interface for the different taint aliasing strategies supported by FlowDroid
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeAliasTaints(Abstraction d1, soot.jimple.Stmt src, soot.Value targetValue, java.util.Set<Abstraction> taintSet, soot.SootMethod method, Abstraction newAbs)
      Computes the taints for the aliases of a given tainted variable
      boolean hasProcessedMethod(soot.SootMethod method)
      Checks whether this aliasing strategy has already computed aliases in the given method or not.
      void injectCallingContext(Abstraction abs, IInfoflowSolver fSolver, soot.SootMethod callee, soot.Unit callSite, Abstraction source, Abstraction d1)
      Notifies the aliasing strategy that a method has been called in the taint analysis.
      boolean isFlowSensitive()
      Gets whether this aliasing strategy is flow sensitive
      boolean isInteractive()
      Gets whether this aliasing strategy is interactive, i.e. computes aliases on demand.
      boolean mayAlias(AccessPath ap1, AccessPath ap2)
      Gets whether the two given access path may alias
      boolean requiresAnalysisOnReturn()
      Gets whether this algorithm requires the analysis to be triggered again when returning from a callee.
      void setForwardSolver(IInfoflowSolver fSolver)
      Sets the forward solver.

    • Method Detail

      • computeAliasTaints

        void computeAliasTaints(Abstraction d1,
                        soot.jimple.Stmt src,
                        soot.Value targetValue,
                        java.util.Set<Abstraction> taintSet,
                        soot.SootMethod method,
                        Abstraction newAbs)
        Computes the taints for the aliases of a given tainted variable
        Parameters:
        d1 - The context in which the variable has been tainted
        src - The statement that tainted the variable
        targetValue - The target value which has been tainted
        taintSet - The set to which all generated alias taints shall be added
        method - The method containing src
        newAbs - The newly generated abstraction for the variable taint

      • isInteractive

        boolean isInteractive()
        Gets whether this aliasing strategy is interactive, i.e. computes aliases on demand.
        Returns:
        True if this is an on-demand aliasing strategy, otherwise false

      • mayAlias

        boolean mayAlias(AccessPath ap1,
                 AccessPath ap2)
        Gets whether the two given access path may alias
        Parameters:
        ap1 - The first access path
        ap2 - The second access path
        Returns:
        True if the two access paths can potentially point ot the same runtime object, otherwise false

      • setForwardSolver

        void setForwardSolver(IInfoflowSolver fSolver)
        Sets the forward solver. Implementors can use this reference to inject edges for taint aliases at right position.
        Parameters:
        fSolver - The forward solver performing the taint propagation

      • injectCallingContext

        void injectCallingContext(Abstraction abs,
                          IInfoflowSolver fSolver,
                          soot.SootMethod callee,
                          soot.Unit callSite,
                          Abstraction source,
                          Abstraction d1)
        Notifies the aliasing strategy that a method has been called in the taint analysis. This may be helpful for interprocedural alias analyses.
        Parameters:
        abs - The abstraction on the callee's start unit
        fSolver - The forward solver propagating the taints
        callee - The callee
        callSite - The call site
        source - The abstraction at the call site
        d1 - The abstraction at the caller method's entry point

      • isFlowSensitive

        boolean isFlowSensitive()
        Gets whether this aliasing strategy is flow sensitive
        Returns:
        True if the aliasing strategy is flow sensitive, otherwise false

      • requiresAnalysisOnReturn

        boolean requiresAnalysisOnReturn()
        Gets whether this algorithm requires the analysis to be triggered again when returning from a callee.
        Returns:
        True if the alias analysis must be triggered again when returning from a method, otherwise false

      • hasProcessedMethod

        boolean hasProcessedMethod(soot.SootMethod method)
        Checks whether this aliasing strategy has already computed aliases in the given method or not. Strategies that do not want to implement this method should always return true.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        Returns:
        True if this aliasing strategy has alreay computed aliases in the given method, otherwise false.
